Pre-Game Insights: Germany are going through a big transition period after several of the senior players announced their retirements from international football.
Die Mannschaft will now mostly focus on the younger core with the likes of Florian Wirtz and Jamal Musiala leading the new generation.
Hungary have built a reputation of being one of the stubborn sides who on their day can take on any opponent.
Marco Rossi’s side will be aiming to bounce back after enduring a disappointing run in the recently concluded Euro 2024.
The team led by Liverpool’s Dominik Szoboszlai, have all the tools to create an upset in League A Group 3 after being drawn against Germany, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Netherlands.
Kai Havertz has impressed everyone with his performances in the number nine role despite not being a traditional nine.
Dominik Szoboszlai has emerged as an important member of this national team.
This move has gone well as he now plays with more responsibility and maturity.
He will be vital in unlocking the German defence with his exceptional vision and passing ability in this match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany are unbeaten in their last six home games
Hungary have scored just six goals in their last five matches
Germany secured a 2-0 win over Hungary when they faced each other last time
